text.content: Nuxt3 is here with all its shenanigans. In this post let's explore its advantages over the older version and also discuss the migration strategy

text.content: nuxt2-to-nuxt3-whats-new

text.content: Nuxt2 vs Nuxt3 - What's new?

Read if you are exploring the new Nuxt3 and wish to know the improvements. Read if you are already using NuxtJS and looking forward to migrating your application or you are a person who could be convinced to move their current stack to NuxtJS.

rich_text.plain_text: Read if you are exploring the new Nuxt3 and wish to know the improvements. Read if you are already using NuxtJS and looking forward to migrating your application or you are a person who could be convinced to move their current stack to NuxtJS.

text.content: It's no surprise that I use NuxtJS extensively. In fact, this website itself is built using ¬†NuxtJS.

rich_text.plain_text: It's no surprise that I use NuxtJS extensively. In fact, this website itself is built using ¬†NuxtJS.

text.content: While Vue had been already upgraded to version 3, bringing about some of the great features and improved performance, Nuxt took its sweet time (mind I say a lot..?) to migrate its underlying foundation to Vue3 (Nuxt is a framework, built over Vue).

rich_text.plain_text: While Vue had been already upgraded to version 3, bringing about some of the great features and improved performance, Nuxt took its sweet time (mind I say a lot..?) to migrate its underlying foundation to Vue3 (Nuxt is a framework, built over Vue).

text.content: But it's finally here.. And I don't know about you...But I'm hella excited.

rich_text.plain_text: But it's finally here.. And I don't know about you...But I'm hella excited.

text.content: Mr. Stark! It smells like a new CAR in here!

caption.plain_text: Mr. Stark! It smells like a new CAR in here!

text.content: Currently, the build is in public Beta. But we can expect to get the full release in the next few months.

text.content: Nuxt 3 has been re-architected with a smaller core and optimized for faster performance and better developer experience.

text.content: With Nuxt3, you have the composition API built-in which is obvious as Nuxt3 is built on top of VueJS3. If you have no idea about Composition API, check out the below article which brings out the contrast between the two - coherently.

text.content: Native TypeScript Support

rich_text.plain_text: Native TypeScript Support

text.content: If you have a large application at your hand. TypeScript is a lifesaver. It makes maintaining your codebase much easier and also reduces bugs.

rich_text.plain_text: If you have a large application at your hand. TypeScript is a lifesaver. It makes maintaining your codebase much easier and also reduces bugs.

text.content: In Nuxt2, this was again achieved using external libraries. A number of configurations had to be done to get proper support.

rich_text.plain_text: In Nuxt2, this was again achieved using external libraries. A number of configurations had to be done to get proper support.

text.content: With Nuxt3, you get TypeScript support out of the box.

rich_text.plain_text: With Nuxt3, you get TypeScript support out of the box.

text.content: Faster Hot reloads with Vite

rich_text.plain_text: Faster Hot reloads with Vite

text.content: Nuxt3 now uses Vite for HMR(Hot Module Replacement). HMR, for those of you who don't know, is used when the server re-renders the updated components of your application both in development and production. I have used Nuxt3 and the hot reload is faster, much, much faster!

rich_text.plain_text: Nuxt3 now uses Vite for HMR(Hot Module Replacement). HMR, for those of you who don't know, is used when the server re-renders the updated components of your application both in development and production. I have used Nuxt3 and the hot reload is faster, much, much faster!

With so many improvements like enhanced renderer, faster Hot Reloads, Webpack 5 improvements, Native support to TypeScript, and Composition API - I have no doubt that Nuxt3 is going to have vastly better performance than its older counterpart.

text.content: Conclusion

rich_text.plain_text: Conclusion

text.content: So! A pretty feature-packed release(to be) I would say!

rich_text.plain_text: So! A pretty feature-packed release(to be) I would say!

text.content: Nuxt3 is still in public beta and I can't wait for the full release. It's here to stay so no hurry in upgrading. I have planned to upgrade this website's stack to Nuxt3 once the framework becomes more stable.

rich_text.plain_text: Nuxt3 is still in public beta and I can't wait for the full release. It's here to stay so no hurry in upgrading. I have planned to upgrade this website's stack to Nuxt3 once the framework becomes more stable.

text.content: If you have a big application and you can't afford to upgrade it anytime soon, try going for Nuxt Bridge?? above. I can assure you that the upgrade is worth the performance and developer experience gains!
